snippet: Michel Kafando, 72, was chosen more than two weeks after the ouster of President Blaise Compaoré, who fled the country in the face of mass protests.
abstract: Authorities name diplomat Michel Kafando to oversee transition to new elections in Burkina Faso after ouster of Pres Blaise Compaore.

byline.original: By HERVÉ TAOKO and ALAN COWELL

lead_paragraph: Michel Kafando, 72, was chosen more than two weeks after the ouster of President Blaise Compaoré, who fled the country in the face of mass protests.

headline.main: Burkina Faso Names Ex-Diplomat as Interim Leader

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
